newsitem.title: USA: DeVry files for offering of 2 mln shares.
newsitem.headline: DeVry files for offering of 2 mln shares.

text.p: DeVry Inc on Thursday filed with the U.S Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to two million common shares.
The company, which owns and operates the DeVry Institutes of Technology and the Keller Graduate School of Management, will sell one million shares, and certain shareholders will offer the remainder.
After the offering, outstanding common will total 34,292,194 shares.

The largest amount of shares will be offered by Ronald Taylor, president and chief operating officer and a director, with 723,000 shares, followed by Dennis Keller, chairman of the board and chief executive officer, with 200,000 shares.

The offering will be made through Smith Barney Inc, ABN AMRO Chicago Corp, Alex. Brown & Sons Inc and Credit Suisse First Boston. The underwriters were granted a 30-day over-allotment option to sell up to 300,000 more shares.
The company, based in Oakbrook Terrace, Ill., will use net proceeds to repay debt.
